module Network.AWS.IoTData.Types.RetainedMessageSummary

-- | Information about a single retained message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetainedMessageSummary</a> smart constructor.
data RetainedMessageSummary
RetainedMessageSummary' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Integer -> RetainedMessageSummary

-- | The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message
--   was stored by IoT.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:RetainedMessageSummary'] :: RetainedMessageSummary -> Maybe Integer

-- | The topic name to which the retained message was published.
[$sel:topic:RetainedMessageSummary'] :: RetainedMessageSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained
--   message.
[$sel:qos:RetainedMessageSummary'] :: RetainedMessageSummary -> Maybe Natural

-- | The size of the retained message's payload in bytes.
[$sel:payloadSize:RetainedMessageSummary'] :: RetainedMessageSummary -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>RetainedMessageSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_lastModifiedTime</a> - The Epoch date and
--   time, in milliseconds, when the retained message was stored by IoT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_topic</a> - The topic name to which the
--   retained message was published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_qos</a> - The quality of service (QoS) level
--   used to publish the retained message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:payloadSize:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_payloadSize</a> - The size of the retained
--   message's payload in bytes.
newRetainedMessageSummary :: RetainedMessageSummary

-- | The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message
--   was stored by IoT.
retainedMessageSummary_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Integer)

-- | The topic name to which the retained message was published.

-- | The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained
--   message.
retainedMessageSummary_qos :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Natural)

-- | The size of the retained message's payload in bytes.
retainedMessageSummary_payloadSize :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Integer)

module Network.AWS.IoTData.Types

-- | API version <tt>2015-05-28</tt> of the Amazon IoT Data Plane SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request is not valid.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified version does not match the version of the document.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The payload exceeds the maximum size allowed.
_RequestEntityTooLargeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The rate exceeds the limit.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
_MethodNotAllowedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unexpected error has occurred.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service is temporarily unavailable.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized to perform this operation.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The document encoding is not supported.
_UnsupportedDocumentEncodingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Publishes an MQTT message.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>Publish</a> action.
--   
--   For more information about MQTT messages, see <a>MQTT Protocol</a> in
--   the IoT Developer Guide.
--   
--   For more information about messaging costs, see <a>IoT Core pricing -
--   Messaging</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTData.Publish

-- | The input for the Publish operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublish</a> smart constructor.
data Publish
Publish' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe ByteString -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Publish

-- | A Boolean value that determines whether to set the RETAIN flag when
--   the message is published.
--   
--   Setting the RETAIN flag causes the message to be retained and sent to
--   new subscribers to the topic.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Default value: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:retain:Publish'] :: Publish -> Maybe Bool

-- | The message body. MQTT accepts text, binary, and empty (null) message
--   payloads.
--   
--   Publishing an empty (null) payload with <b>retain</b> = <tt>true</tt>
--   deletes the retained message identified by <b>topic</b> from IoT Core.
[$sel:payload:Publish'] :: Publish -> Maybe ByteString

-- | The Quality of Service (QoS) level.
[$sel:qos:Publish'] :: Publish -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of the MQTT topic.
[$sel:topic:Publish'] :: Publish -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Publish</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retain:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_retain</a> - A Boolean value
--   that determines whether to set the RETAIN flag when the message is
--   published.
--   
--   Setting the RETAIN flag causes the message to be retained and sent to
--   new subscribers to the topic.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Default value: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_payload</a> - The message
--   body. MQTT accepts text, binary, and empty (null) message payloads.
--   
--   Publishing an empty (null) payload with <b>retain</b> = <tt>true</tt>
--   deletes the retained message identified by <b>topic</b> from IoT Core.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_qos</a> - The Quality of Service
--   (QoS) level.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_topic</a> - The name of the
--   MQTT topic.
newPublish :: Text -> Publish

-- | A Boolean value that determines whether to set the RETAIN flag when
--   the message is published.
--   
--   Setting the RETAIN flag causes the message to be retained and sent to
--   new subscribers to the topic.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Default value: <tt>false</tt>
publish_retain :: Lens' Publish (Maybe Bool)

-- | The message body. MQTT accepts text, binary, and empty (null) message
--   payloads.
--   
--   Publishing an empty (null) payload with <b>retain</b> = <tt>true</tt>
--   deletes the retained message identified by <b>topic</b> from IoT Core.
publish_payload :: Lens' Publish (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The Quality of Service (QoS) level.
publish_qos :: Lens' Publish (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the MQTT topic.
publish_topic :: Lens' Publish Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPublishResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PublishResponse
PublishResponse' :: PublishResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PublishResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newPublishResponse :: PublishResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTData.Publish.Publish

-- | Lists summary information about the retained messages stored for the
--   account.
--   
--   This action returns only the topic names of the retained messages. It
--   doesn't return any message payloads. Although this action doesn't
--   return a message payload, it can still incur messaging costs.
--   
--   To get the message payload of a retained message, call
--   <a>GetRetainedMessage</a> with the topic name of the retained message.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListRetainedMessages</a> action.
--   
--   For more information about messaging costs, see <a>IoT Core pricing -
--   Messaging</a>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTData.ListRetainedMessages

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListRetainedMessages</a> smart constructor.
data ListRetainedMessages
ListRetainedMessages' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListRetainedMessages

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRetainedMessages'] :: ListRetainedMessages -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
[$sel:maxResults:ListRetainedMessages'] :: ListRetainedMessages -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRetainedMessages</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRetainedMessages'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessages_nextToken</a> - To retrieve the next set of
--   results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from a previous response;
--   otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListRetainedMessages'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessages_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return at one time.
newListRetainedMessages :: ListRetainedMessages

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of
--   results.
listRetainedMessages_nextToken :: Lens' ListRetainedMessages (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
listRetainedMessages_maxResults :: Lens' ListRetainedMessages (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListRetainedMessagesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListRetainedMessagesResponse
ListRetainedMessagesResponse' :: Maybe [RetainedMessageSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListRetainedMessagesResponse

-- | A summary list the account's retained messages. The information
--   returned doesn't include the message payloads of the retained
--   messages.
[$sel:retainedTopics:ListRetainedMessagesResponse'] :: ListRetainedMessagesResponse -> Maybe [RetainedMessageSummary]

-- | The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no
--   additional results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRetainedMessagesResponse'] :: ListRetainedMessagesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListRetainedMessagesResponse'] :: ListRetainedMessagesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRetainedMessagesResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>listRetainedMessagesResponse_retainedTopics</a> - A summary list
--   the account's retained messages. The information returned doesn't
--   include the message payloads of the retained messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRetainedMessages'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessagesResponse_nextToken</a> - The token for the next
--   set of results, or null if there are no additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListRetainedMessagesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessagesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListRetainedMessagesResponse :: Int -> ListRetainedMessagesResponse

-- | A summary list the account's retained messages. The information
--   returned doesn't include the message payloads of the retained
--   messages.
listRetainedMessagesResponse_retainedTopics :: Lens' ListRetainedMessagesResponse (Maybe [RetainedMessageSummary])

--   additional results.
listRetainedMessagesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRetainedMessagesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listRetainedMessagesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListRetainedMessagesResponse Int

-- | Gets the shadow for the specified thing.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>GetThingShadow</a> action.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>GetThingShadow</a> in the IoT Developer
--   Guide.
module Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow

-- | The input for the GetThingShadow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetThingShadow</a> smart constructor.
data GetThingShadow
GetThingShadow' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetThingShadow

-- | The name of the shadow.
[$sel:shadowName:GetThingShadow'] :: GetThingShadow -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:GetThingShadow'] :: GetThingShadow -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetThingShadow</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowName:GetThingShadow'</a>,
--   <a>getThingShadow_shadowName</a> - The name of the shadow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:GetThingShadow'</a>, <a>getThingShadow_thingName</a>
--   - The name of the thing.
newGetThingShadow :: Text -> GetThingShadow

-- | The name of the shadow.
getThingShadow_shadowName :: Lens' GetThingShadow (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the thing.
getThingShadow_thingName :: Lens' GetThingShadow Text

-- | The output from the GetThingShadow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetThingShadowResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetThingShadowResponse
GetThingShadowResponse' :: Maybe ByteString -> Int -> GetThingShadowResponse

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
[$sel:payload:GetThingShadowResponse'] :: GetThingShadowResponse -> Maybe ByteString

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetThingShadowResponse'] :: GetThingShadowResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetThingShadowResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:GetThingShadowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getThingShadowResponse_payload</a> - The state information, in JSON
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetThingShadowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getThingShadowResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetThingShadowResponse :: Int -> GetThingShadowResponse

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
getThingShadowResponse_payload :: Lens' GetThingShadowResponse (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The response's http status code.
getThingShadowResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetThingShadowResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadowResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadowResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IoTData.GetThingShadow.GetThingShadow


-- | Gets the details of a single retained message for the specified topic.
--   
--   This action returns the message payload of the retained message, which
--   can incur messaging costs. To list only the topic names of the
--   retained messages, call <a>ListRetainedMessages</a>.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>GetRetainedMessage</a> action.
--   
--   For more information about messaging costs, see <a>IoT Core pricing -
--   Messaging</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage

-- | The input for the GetRetainedMessage operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRetainedMessage</a> smart constructor.
data GetRetainedMessage
GetRetainedMessage' :: Text -> GetRetainedMessage

-- | The topic name of the retained message to retrieve.
[$sel:topic:GetRetainedMessage'] :: GetRetainedMessage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRetainedMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:GetRetainedMessage'</a>, <a>getRetainedMessage_topic</a>
--   - The topic name of the retained message to retrieve.
newGetRetainedMessage :: Text -> GetRetainedMessage

-- | The topic name of the retained message to retrieve.
getRetainedMessage_topic :: Lens' GetRetainedMessage Text

-- | The output from the GetRetainedMessage operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRetainedMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetRetainedMessageResponse
GetRetainedMessageResponse' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Base64 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Int -> GetRetainedMessageResponse

-- | The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message
--   was stored by IoT.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:GetRetainedMessageResponse'] :: GetRetainedMessageResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Base64-encoded message payload of the retained message body.
[$sel:payload:GetRetainedMessageResponse'] :: GetRetainedMessageResponse -> Maybe Base64

-- | The topic name to which the retained message was published.
[$sel:topic:GetRetainedMessageResponse'] :: GetRetainedMessageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained
--   message.
[$sel:qos:GetRetainedMessageResponse'] :: GetRetainedMessageResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetRetainedMessageResponse'] :: GetRetainedMessageResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRetainedMessageResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_lastModifiedTime</a> - The Epoch date
--   and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message was stored by
--   IoT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_payload</a> - The Base64-encoded message
--   payload of the retained message body.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:GetRetainedMessage'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_topic</a> - The topic name to which the
--   retained message was published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_qos</a> - The quality of service (QoS)
--   level used to publish the retained message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetRetainedMessageResponse :: Int -> GetRetainedMessageResponse

-- | The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message
--   was stored by IoT.
getRetainedMessageResponse_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Base64-encoded message payload of the retained message body.-- --
--   <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
getRetainedMessageResponse_payload :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The topic name to which the retained message was published.
getRetainedMessageResponse_topic :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained
--   message.
getRetainedMessageResponse_qos :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe Natural)

-- | The response's http status code.
getRetainedMessageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessageResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessageResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessageResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessageResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessageResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IoTData.GetRetainedMessage.GetRetainedMessage


-- | Deletes the shadow for the specified thing.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteThingShadow</a> action.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>DeleteThingShadow</a> in the IoT
--   Developer Guide.
module Network.AWS.IoTData.DeleteThingShadow

-- | The input for the DeleteThingShadow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteThingShadow</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteThingShadow
DeleteThingShadow' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteThingShadow

-- | The name of the shadow.
[$sel:shadowName:DeleteThingShadow'] :: DeleteThingShadow -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:DeleteThingShadow'] :: DeleteThingShadow -> Text

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>deleteThingShadow_shadowName</a> - The name of the shadow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DeleteThingShadow'</a>,
--   <a>deleteThingShadow_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.

deleteThingShadow_shadowName :: Lens' DeleteThingShadow (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the thing.
deleteThingShadow_thingName :: Lens' DeleteThingShadow Text

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteThingShadowResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteThingShadowResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteThingShadowResponse'] :: DeleteThingShadowResponse -> Int

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
[$sel:payload:DeleteThingShadowResponse'] :: DeleteThingShadowResponse -> ByteString

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteThingShadowResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   status code.

-- | Updates the shadow for the specified thing.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateThingShadow</a> action.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>UpdateThingShadow</a> in the IoT
--   Developer Guide.
module Network.AWS.IoTData.UpdateThingShadow

-- | The input for the UpdateThingShadow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateThingShadow</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateThingShadow
UpdateThingShadow' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ByteString -> UpdateThingShadow

-- | The name of the shadow.
[$sel:shadowName:UpdateThingShadow'] :: UpdateThingShadow -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:UpdateThingShadow'] :: UpdateThingShadow -> Text

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
[$sel:payload:UpdateThingShadow'] :: UpdateThingShadow -> ByteString

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateThingShadow</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:UpdateThingShadow'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingShadow_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.
--

--   format.

--   fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   JSON format.

--   <a>updateThingShadowResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http

module Network.AWS.IoTData.Lens

-- | The name of the shadow.
getThingShadow_shadowName :: Lens' GetThingShadow (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the thing.
getThingShadow_thingName :: Lens' GetThingShadow Text

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
getThingShadowResponse_payload :: Lens' GetThingShadowResponse (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The response's http status code.
getThingShadowResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetThingShadowResponse Int

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results.
listNamedShadowsForThing_nextToken :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThing (Maybe Text)

-- | The result page size.
listNamedShadowsForThing_pageSize :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThing (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the thing.
listNamedShadowsForThing_thingName :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThing Text

-- | The list of shadows for the specified thing.
listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_results :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The token to use to get the next set of results, or <b>null</b> if
--   there are no additional results.
listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Epoch date and time the response was generated by IoT.
listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_timestamp :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The response's http status code.
listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListNamedShadowsForThingResponse Int

-- | The name of the shadow.
deleteThingShadow_shadowName :: Lens' DeleteThingShadow (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the thing.
deleteThingShadow_thingName :: Lens' DeleteThingShadow Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteThingShadowResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteThingShadowResponse Int

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
deleteThingShadowResponse_payload :: Lens' DeleteThingShadowResponse ByteString

-- | The name of the shadow.
updateThingShadow_shadowName :: Lens' UpdateThingShadow (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the thing.
updateThingShadow_thingName :: Lens' UpdateThingShadow Text

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
updateThingShadow_payload :: Lens' UpdateThingShadow ByteString

-- | The state information, in JSON format.
updateThingShadowResponse_payload :: Lens' UpdateThingShadowResponse (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateThingShadowResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateThingShadowResponse Int

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of
--   results.
listRetainedMessages_nextToken :: Lens' ListRetainedMessages (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
listRetainedMessages_maxResults :: Lens' ListRetainedMessages (Maybe Natural)

-- | A summary list the account's retained messages. The information
--   returned doesn't include the message payloads of the retained
--   messages.
listRetainedMessagesResponse_retainedTopics :: Lens' ListRetainedMessagesResponse (Maybe [RetainedMessageSummary])

-- | The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no
--   additional results.
listRetainedMessagesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRetainedMessagesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listRetainedMessagesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListRetainedMessagesResponse Int

-- | The topic name of the retained message to retrieve.
getRetainedMessage_topic :: Lens' GetRetainedMessage Text

-- | The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message
--   was stored by IoT.
getRetainedMessageResponse_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Base64-encoded message payload of the retained message body.-- --
--   <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
getRetainedMessageResponse_payload :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The topic name to which the retained message was published.
getRetainedMessageResponse_topic :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained
--   message.
getRetainedMessageResponse_qos :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse (Maybe Natural)

-- | The response's http status code.
getRetainedMessageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRetainedMessageResponse Int

-- | A Boolean value that determines whether to set the RETAIN flag when
--   the message is published.
--   
--   Setting the RETAIN flag causes the message to be retained and sent to
--   new subscribers to the topic.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Default value: <tt>false</tt>
publish_retain :: Lens' Publish (Maybe Bool)

-- | The message body. MQTT accepts text, binary, and empty (null) message
--   payloads.
--   
--   Publishing an empty (null) payload with <b>retain</b> = <tt>true</tt>
--   deletes the retained message identified by <b>topic</b> from IoT Core.
publish_payload :: Lens' Publish (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The Quality of Service (QoS) level.
publish_qos :: Lens' Publish (Maybe Natural)

-- | The name of the MQTT topic.
publish_topic :: Lens' Publish Text

-- | The Epoch date and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message
--   was stored by IoT.
retainedMessageSummary_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Integer)

-- | The topic name to which the retained message was published.
retainedMessageSummary_topic :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The quality of service (QoS) level used to publish the retained
--   message.
retainedMessageSummary_qos :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Natural)

-- | The size of the retained message's payload in bytes.
retainedMessageSummary_payloadSize :: Lens' RetainedMessageSummary (Maybe Integer)


module Network.AWS.IoTData.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2015-05-28</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   IoT data
--   
--   IoT data enables secure, bi-directional communication between
--   Internet-connected things (such as sensors, actuators, embedded
--   devices, or smart appliances) and the Amazon Web Services cloud. It
--   implements a broker for applications and things to publish messages
--   over HTTP (Publish) and retrieve, update, and delete shadows. A shadow
--   is a persistent representation of your things and their state in the
--   Amazon Web Services cloud.
--   
--   Find the endpoint address for actions in IoT data by running this CLI
--   command:
--   
--   <pre>
--   aws iot describe-endpoint --endpoint-type iot:Data-ATS
--   </pre>
--   
--   The service name used by <a>Amazon Web ServicesSignature Version 4</a>
--   to sign requests is: <i>iotdevicegateway</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTData

-- | API version <tt>2015-05-28</tt> of the Amazon IoT Data Plane SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request is not valid.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified version does not match the version of the document.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The payload exceeds the maximum size allowed.
_RequestEntityTooLargeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The rate exceeds the limit.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified combination of HTTP verb and URI is not supported.
_MethodNotAllowedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unexpected error has occurred.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service is temporarily unavailable.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized to perform this operation.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The document encoding is not supported.
_UnsupportedDocumentEncodingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The input for the GetThingShadow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetThingShadow</a> smart constructor.
data GetThingShadow
GetThingShadow' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> GetThingShadow

-- | Create a value of <a>GetThingShadow</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadowName:GetThingShadow'</a>,
--   <a>getThingShadow_shadowName</a> - The name of the shadow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:GetThingShadow'</a>, <a>getThingShadow_thingName</a>
--   - The name of the thing.
newGetThingShadow :: Text -> GetThingShadow

-- | The output from the GetThingShadow operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetThingShadowResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetThingShadowResponse
GetThingShadowResponse' :: Maybe ByteString -> Int -> GetThingShadowResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetThingShadowResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:GetThingShadowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getThingShadowResponse_payload</a> - The state information, in JSON
--   format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetThingShadowResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getThingShadowResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetThingShadowResponse :: Int -> GetThingShadowResponse

--   <a>listNamedShadowsForThing_pageSize</a> - The result page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ListNamedShadowsForThing'</a>,
--   <a>listNamedShadowsForThing_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListNamedShadowsForThingResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   for the specified thing.
--

--   <a>listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_nextToken</a> - The token to use
--   to get the next set of results, or <b>null</b> if there are no
--   additional results.
--

--   <a>listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_timestamp</a> - The Epoch date and
--   time the response was generated by IoT.

--   <a>listNamedShadowsForThingResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from a previous response;
--   otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListRetainedMessages'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessages_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return at one time.
newListRetainedMessages :: ListRetainedMessages

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListRetainedMessagesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListRetainedMessagesResponse
ListRetainedMessagesResponse' :: Maybe [RetainedMessageSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListRetainedMessagesResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRetainedMessagesResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retainedTopics:ListRetainedMessagesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessagesResponse_retainedTopics</a> - A summary list
--   the account's retained messages. The information returned doesn't
--   include the message payloads of the retained messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRetainedMessages'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessagesResponse_nextToken</a> - The token for the next
--   set of results, or null if there are no additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListRetainedMessagesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listRetainedMessagesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListRetainedMessagesResponse :: Int -> ListRetainedMessagesResponse

-- | The input for the GetRetainedMessage operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRetainedMessage</a> smart constructor.
data GetRetainedMessage
GetRetainedMessage' :: Text -> GetRetainedMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRetainedMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:GetRetainedMessage'</a>, <a>getRetainedMessage_topic</a>
--   - The topic name of the retained message to retrieve.
newGetRetainedMessage :: Text -> GetRetainedMessage

-- | The output from the GetRetainedMessage operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRetainedMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetRetainedMessageResponse
GetRetainedMessageResponse' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Base64 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Int -> GetRetainedMessageResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRetainedMessageResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_lastModifiedTime</a> - The Epoch date
--   and time, in milliseconds, when the retained message was stored by
--   IoT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_payload</a> - The Base64-encoded message
--   payload of the retained message body.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:GetRetainedMessage'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_topic</a> - The topic name to which the
--   retained message was published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_qos</a> - The quality of service (QoS)
--   level used to publish the retained message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetRetainedMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRetainedMessageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetRetainedMessageResponse :: Int -> GetRetainedMessageResponse

-- | The input for the Publish operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublish</a> smart constructor.
data Publish
Publish' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe ByteString -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Publish

-- | Create a value of <a>Publish</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retain:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_retain</a> - A Boolean value
--   that determines whether to set the RETAIN flag when the message is
--   published.
--   
--   Setting the RETAIN flag causes the message to be retained and sent to
--   new subscribers to the topic.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Default value: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_payload</a> - The message
--   body. MQTT accepts text, binary, and empty (null) message payloads.
--   
--   Publishing an empty (null) payload with <b>retain</b> = <tt>true</tt>
--   deletes the retained message identified by <b>topic</b> from IoT Core.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_qos</a> - The Quality of Service
--   (QoS) level.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:Publish'</a>, <a>publish_topic</a> - The name of the
--   MQTT topic.
newPublish :: Text -> Publish

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPublishResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PublishResponse
PublishResponse' :: PublishResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PublishResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newPublishResponse :: PublishResponse

-- | Information about a single retained message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRetainedMessageSummary</a> smart constructor.
data RetainedMessageSummary
RetainedMessageSummary' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Integer -> RetainedMessageSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>RetainedMessageSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_lastModifiedTime</a> - The Epoch date and
--   time, in milliseconds, when the retained message was stored by IoT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_topic</a> - The topic name to which the
--   retained message was published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_qos</a> - The quality of service (QoS) level
--   used to publish the retained message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:payloadSize:RetainedMessageSummary'</a>,
--   <a>retainedMessageSummary_payloadSize</a> - The size of the retained
--   message's payload in bytes.
newRetainedMessageSummary :: RetainedMessageSummary
